author: James Tanner
method: Preheat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas6 Roll the marzipan squares to 1cm/½in thickness. Place the two 12-inch squares of layered filo pastry onto a floured surface. Brush each pastry square with melted butter. Place one marzipan square in the centre of each pastry square. Place a peach half flat-side down on top of each marzipan square. Fold in the corners, making sure each peach in the centre is visible. Brush with the melted butter and transfer to a baking tray. Bake for six minutes. To serve, place on a plate with a dusting of icing sugar.
ingredients: 2 x 100g/3½oz/12-inch squares of ready-made filo pastry,  2 x 100g/3½oz/12-inch square slices marzipan,  50g/1¾oz unsalted butter, melted,  2 peach halves ,  icing sugar for dusting
